question: How we doing?
answer: We'll see...

question: ...in Nature, evolution is a long, leisurely conversation between an organism and its environment. We, however, did not have the luxury of time...
answer: With the aid of genetic labs throughout the country, we recombined cockroach DNA with genetic information from termites and mantids. We were able to create a biological counter-agent. A new ally, if you will... Blattida Traditor. The "Judas Roach". The Judas is a non-carrier of Stricklers, with a short life-span and heightened pheromone emission. The female is basically a sexual magnet; common males travelled miles and fought for the right to mate with them. When they did, they took away something else we added -- a hormone, passed through sexual congress that causes their metabolism to go into overdrive. No matter what their food intake, they starved to death in a matter of hours.

question: We've achieved almost total eradication of the roach population. As of today, the disease has been officially contained. Sus, come on. You're missing it. Fucking thing! I hope someone's taping this. Susan, come on. It's really good this time. I got most of the lines out. Sus? Life's a bitch. Our 15 minutes came and went and all we got was bad cable... Hiding from the hard glare of publicity? A shame. You looked great tonight.
answer: Please.

question: You did!
answer: Do you think we did the right thing?

question: Taking a cab instead of hiring a limo?
answer: You know what I mean... We did no impact evaluation. The consequences of...

question: Is this a Catholic guilt thing...? You hear that? Flawless.
answer: We just don't know.

question: We know we saved lives. There're gonna be a lot of kids running around next year because of you. Who know? We get lucky, maybe a couple of 'em'll be ours.
answer: We're down to a "couple" now, huh?

question: Oh, I don't know. People are beginning to talk about us...
answer: Don't worry, I'll save your honor. Maybe I'll even marry you.

question: Excuse me, ladies...
answer: ...no, guys, these have to fit perfectly. No spaces in between. Let me tell you why. Insects have no hands. All they have is this set of mandibles. See? This little piggy will grab the prey. Then this little piggy will tear it in half... ...and this little one will grind it to a pulp and push it in... all the way into the mouth. These are precision tools here. Can you remember that? Good. Then get it right.

question: "Baby in a bottle..."
answer: Don't tease.

question: You know where they get this fertility stuff? They extract it from the urine of menopausal Italian nuns.
answer: Monks bottle their own wine. Don't they? Trust me. I've never been this late. Never. If nun's pee is what it takes... You were the one who ran around with ice in his underwear, don't forget that.

question: Don't get kinky here... Okay, meet me out front. I gotta go. Josh's picking me up in five. see you tonight.
answer: I'll be late. Siri, sandblast that thing. It looks like Trump Tower. Those mounds are supposed to be made of dirt and excretions...

question: ...So I say "buddy, you have every violation in the book. Gimme one good reason not to close you down." You know what the Kraut says to me? The blintzes! "Try the blintzes..."
answer: Selling your sould for a fistful of carbohydrates...

question: Not just any carbohydrates, mind you. It was like being on the receiving end of some kind of transcendent oral sex. We should get a strobe on this thing. Maybe even a siren.
answer: Yeah, and a loudspeaker so you can yell "Epidemic! Epidemic! You're all going to die!"

question: Health Department...
answer: You really love flashing that thing, don't you?

question: Hey. I'm a short guy. Waddaya want?
answer: Peter Tyler, DOH. You gentlemen were the first on the scene? You gone in? Good. Get the EMT's in there, now.

question: ...as long as they're ready for the opening I don't care, just tell them that.
answer: I'm on it. Don't worry. Look, Susan...I don't mean to pry, but... I kinda overheard you and Peter.

question: Watch your step, Siri. Your grant could be on the line here.
answer: I just...well, I had this cousin in Delhi. She was having problems, too. She, ah...

question: What?
answer: She used a baster. Not a big one. I mean, it was like a turkey baster.

question: Oh, Jesus. Come on, darlin'...
answer: She kept it under her bed. Thing is, it kinda worked. I mean, she had to hide it from her husband, but...

question: What's this?
answer: Oh, right... They been here since noon. I told them you're real busy.

question: Hello.
answer: You the bug lady, right?

question: I suppose so.
answer: We're here to deal.

question: There's plenty of systemic infection already, so as soon as we get a preliminary reading, start them on anti-biotics. You saw this? Internal hemorrage. 2 our of 5 have it. No definite signs of TB, but we'll quarantine them a week just to make sure.
answer: Immigration's gonna love you for that.

question: Tell them to send flowers to the usual address.
answer: Two shifts, people rotating from bed to work. One toilet. We're in Wal-Mart hell, here.

question: Did they get the sleazebag who owns this place?
answer: Triad, Chinese Mafia. They bring people from Yunan. Slave labor... Reverend Harry Wong, a preacher had the flophouse fronting for them. No sign of him.

question: Siri? Siri?!
answer: ...the fuck?

question: Can you...? Could you...help me...? I'm gonna pull it out and I want you to pin it down, okay?
answer: What is it?

question: I have no idea. Are you ready?
answer: Oh my God... Shit!! Get it! Get it!

question: It bit you.
answer: No shit.

question: leans to get a closer look at the NYMPH This wing configuration. I've never...
answer: Fuck! It broke the skin...

question: And they're not fully developed. This thing's not even an adult. My God.
answer: What?

question: It's breathing.
answer: shakes her head. That's impossible. Insects don't...

question: I know. Help me get a sample. Hold on, big guy, hold on... prepares a blue solution and places two drops on each smear slide. watches the smear slide. The blue droplets begin to CHANGE COLOR once in contact with the leg section... Hold on a second...
answer: What? Susan?

question: Josh, what was Immigration's countdown?
answer: Thirty-three workers.

question: There are thirty five listed in the reverend Wong's roster...
answer: Shit.

question: Remember what that woman said, about people being taken? Check with the copsin the area. Sus? Susan? Thought it was my week for that.
answer: I needed to think. It was either this or the weather channel. This thing was the size of my fist, Peter!! That's off the charts!

question: Okay. So you lost a great specimen-
answer: Don't you get it? It's more than that. You know why insects don't grow larger? Because they don't have a complex respiratory system. What I saw did. It had lungs. Evolution doesn't work that fast. Something pushed that thing to take the leap. We need to find another specimen.

question: We?
answer: I did a PH test on its tarsal pads. There's only two species who match the enzymes I found. One's a leaf-cutter ant in the Amazon... The other we released here two years ago. Keep going. We'll tell you when to stop...

question: Maybe they lied to you.
answer: Even if they did... that's all we have, isn't it? Pull over! Metaxonycha Godmani.

question: Let's keep it at five and I won't condemn your clubhouse. inspects the floor. It's littered with cheap objects Look, a broken tooth...
answer: kneeling, pushes aside a dented trash bin. Behind it, there is a cabinet with rusty sliding doors.

question: at the oddly texture wall. He shines the penlight at it...
answer: You okay? turns back to her locker. She withdraws a cheap PLASTIC NECKLACE from it. As she removes it, it breaks. A coulpe of beads fall away... There's something under here.

question: Shit.
answer: Let me try. My hands are smaller.

question: Honey, just leave it.
answer: No, there's... reaches further.

question: Now don't tell me. You lost a token, right?
answer: Look, I showed you my badge...

question: Yeah, and you gonna have to show me a lot bigger one you wanna go down there. That's the old maintenance grid, Doc. Swiss cheese
answer: The Department of Public Health...

question: ...should know better'n to go sneakin' around my turf...
answer: Fine. You want me to call your supervisor?

question: You give someone a fucking uniform and... Did you hear how he talked to us?
answer: I heard how you talked to him.

question: Oh, so I'm the bad guy now?
answer: He was just doing his job.

question: Heya. Where's the boss?
answer: Ant mound.

question: You okay?
answer: It's just a headache. We were sandblasting Trump Tower here since four this morning.

question: Maybe you should sit...
answer: I'm fine. Go talk to Susan. She could use a good word right now.

question: approaches Susan. She's staring through thr glass panes of the exhibit at the crowd of patrons. In the refraction, their black tuxedoes and evening gowns seem to blend into one another. Great crowd.
answer: No such thing, baby. I get the feeling they came more for the potroast than the apterids.

question: Fuck 'em. They don't know what they're missing.
answer: Right.

question: What's wrong?
answer: Oh...nothing that a little menopausal's pee daikiri couldn't cure. Least that's what I thought.

question: Oh, no, you were-
answer: I was just late. Ironic, don't you think? These guys can hatch hundreds of offspring in a single clutch of eggs, right? And here we are...

question: ...you don't even know what you're looking for.
answer: You said that thing was big as your hand. I don't think I'm going to miss...

question: Why take the chance? Just let me go down there with you...
answer: No. Susan, listen to me

question: It didn't bite me.
answer: I know. But if it was carrying something...there's a chance you could have been exposed. Chris is going to run some blood tests on you. I want you to stay here till he's absolutely sure you're clean. Okay? Then you'll call me... You'll catch up with us... We'll be all right, Sus. I promise.

question: How you feeling?
answer: You tell me.

question: Your blood tests were all negative. You checked out.
answer: What about Siri?

question: She's stable. I don't think there's any immediate danger, but we'll have to keep her under observation...
answer: You think it's some form of Strickler's, don't you?

question: ...how many times I gotta tell you, man Take it out back and throw it in the friggin' dumpster!
answer: Oh, my God.

question: Hey, you can't...
answer: What's your name?

question: Jeremy...
answer: Okay, Jeremy...go get Dr. Chris Raymond, will you?

question: Lady...
answer: Did you hear me? Get Dr. Raymond! NOW!!

question: Okay.
answer: Where'd you find it?

question: Smells like acid.
answer: Ammonia.

question: Peter...
answer: Yeah...?

question: There's some weird shit here.
answer: Weird shit...?

question: I've never been this deep. This area here is the Old Armory station. They built it in the 40's. Ran out of money half-way through... Okay, the fat lady's singing. Time to go.
answer: I want a team in here by six tonight, hands and knees with toothpicks... putting the last sample boxes into the back-pack, looks up and sees

question: step onto the scaffolding, raising the rock to crush the nymph.
answer: Don't!!

question: Did you see the size of that thing?!
answer: Look what you did! You stupid sonofa-

question: It's okay. I'm all right.
answer: Get the hell away from me!

question: He's all right, too.
answer: Oh, that's gonna work.

question: You got a better way up?
answer: Show that to the station manager. Tell him Leonard's gonna have his bubble-butt he don't have someone down here in ten.

question: Show that to the station manager. Tell him Leonard's gonna have his bubble-butt he don't have someone down here in ten.
answer: H-how do I get...?

question: Way we came. Take the first tunnel to your right... Go left. Go left again till you hit the fork... Then right again. You got that?
answer: I think so. One right, two lefts...

question: And a right.
answer: Right.

question: Any luck?
answer: Well...there's an old service elevator half a mile down the tracks. Ain't gonna be much use, though. Lines are dead.

question: You said those cables're still live. Can't we rewire...?
answer: Oh, man, there you go again.

question: What?
answer: Those things bring juice to the new stations. You just can't rewire that shit...

question: For Chrissakes, what's the problem? You need a memo every time you fart?

question: Shh! Shh!

question: Just keep holding it. Can you do that for me? Susan?
answer: Doctor Tyler?

question: You feel anything?
answer: Yeah, I feel like ripping your fucking eyes out...

question: Leonard, listen. I need to see if there's any nerve damage before we carry you back. Look, I'm trying to help you here...
answer: Oh, you helped me here, all right, white boy. You and your goddam memo. You needed to prove your point, uh?

question: A BUZZ OF WINGS catches his attention. He turns. His face is reflected in a security window.
answer: Oh, God. The blood... His blood! It's driving them crazy! We have to mask the odor!

question: How?! It's no use! They know we're in here!
answer: They don't know anything Peter, they just sense. They're hardwired!

question: Right. Hardwired to eat anything that's not like them!

question: Peter, you couldn't even fix our TV!

question: Peter-
answer: It worked before...

question: The scent won't last...

question: approaches Manny, who looks distractedly out the window.
answer: He's out there. I heard him. How can he be? This things...

question: Manny...

question: Nino, please... Dios mio... Chuy...
answer: Friends.

question: NO, NO, CHUY, NO...

question: He didn't do it!

question: Can't feel it.

question: Lemme go.
